DataElement.preferredName: Other Not Genetic Cytopenia Syndrome Classification Disease Diagnosis Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe another non-genetic cytopenia syndrome classification.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Other Not Genetic Cytopenia Syndrome Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Inherited; having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells._A reduction in the number of blood cells._(SIN-drome) A set of symptoms or conditions that occur together and suggest the presence of a certain disease or an increased chance of developing the disease._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells; inherited.:A reduction in the number of blood cells.:a set of symptoms, usually three or more, which occur together and characterize a particular pathological state; for thorough searching see the Permuted Term Index for specific syndromes.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.
A laboratory test result indicating an abnormally low quantity of circulating blood cells.
A group of signs, symptoms, and clinicopathological characteristics that may or may not have a genetic basis and collectively define an abnormal condition.

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.
